{"step_by_step_thinking": "T-cells are a type of white blood cell that play a key role in the immune system. They express different markers at different stages of their development. CD1a, CD34, and Tdt are all markers that are expressed on the surface of T-cells at some stage of their development. However, PAX5 is a transcription factor that is typically associated with B-cell development, not T-cell development.", "answer_choice": "B. PAX5"}
